snippet: Secretary of State John Kerry and Sergey V. Lavrov, his Russian counterpart, said they agreed that the Islamic State must be defeated and that talks were a positive sign.

byline.contributor: Matthew Rosenberg reported from Vienna, and Neil MacFarquhar from Moscow.
byline.original: By MATTHEW ROSENBERG and NEIL MacFARQUHAR

abstract: Secretary of State John Kerry meets with his Russian counterpart Sergey V Lavrov to discuss civil war in Syria yet they fail to come to agreement about future of Pres Bashar al-Assad; Kerry says fact that two countries were talking about issue is good sign.

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations

lead_paragraph: Secretary of State John Kerry and Sergey V. Lavrov, his Russian counterpart, said they agreed that the Islamic State must be defeated and that talks were a positive sign.

headline.print_headline: U.S. and Russia Seek Common Ground on Syria
headline.main: U.S. and Russia Find Common Goals on Syria, if Not on Assad
